You cannot buy the revolution. You cannot make the revolution. You can only be the revolution. It is in your spirit, or it is nowhere.
quotes.attribution: Ursula K. Le Guin, The Dispossessed

quotes.quote: You can't understand a codebase without knowing the aspirations of the company at the time.
Continuous improvement is better than delayed perfection.
So much complexity in software comes from trying to make one thing do two things.
When a service 'predicts' what 'you' want, it is actually reshaping you into what makes it profitable.
When writing code, you're always collaborating with future-you; and past-you doesn't respond to emails.
Software is a liquid. It fills whatever hardware container into which it is poured.
You can use an eraser on the drafting table or a sledge hammer on the construction site.
Every day, computers are making people easier to use.
Authority without wisdom is like a heavy axe without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish.
Amateurs have a goal. Professionals have a process.
People are fairly good at short-term design, and usually awful at long-term design.
There is nothing more permanent than a temporary hack.
The greatest occupational risk of being successful in tech is the idea that because you know how computers work that society owes you fealty and subservience.
We build our computer systems the way we build our cities: over time, without a plan, on top of ruins.
There is nothing more unproductive than to build something efficiently that should not have been built at all.
In programming, the hard part isn't solving problems, but deciding what problems to solve.
The hardest part of being a developer isn't the code, it's learning that the entire internet is put together with peanut butter and goblins.
Understand well as I may, my comprehension can only be an infinitesimal fraction of all I want to understand.
The trick is to fix the problem you have, rather than the problem you want.
A ship in port is safe, but that is not what ships are for. Sail out to sea and do new things.
Never trust a computer you can't throw out a window.
If you want something new, you have to stop doing something old.
Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning.
Crunch is not a triumph of the workforce. It is a failure of the management.
A primary cause of complexity is that software vendors uncritically adopt almost any feature that users want.
The question is not if we will be extremists, but what kind of extremists we will be. The nation and the world are in dire need of creative extremists.
Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.
That so few now dare to be eccentric marks the chief danger of our time.
The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
When you can do a common thing in an uncommon way; you will command the attention of the world.
The cheapest, fastest, and most reliable components are those that aren�t there.
Process that is heavy is process that is eventually abandoned ... provided it doesn't kill you first.
The ambiguous meaning of human experience is somewhat at odds with the capacities of computers; machines transform things into numbers, whereas humans transform numbers into meaning.
Leaders who don't listen will eventually be surrounded by people who have nothing to say.
The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
Managers will try anything easy that doesn't work before they will try anything hard that does work.
If everyone is thinking alike, then someone isn't thinking.
We die. That may be the meaning of life. But we do language. That may be the measure of our lives.
If you are not willing to learn, no one can help you. If you are determined to learn, no one can stop you
We're all stories, in the end. Just make it a good one, eh?
quotes.attribution: Doctor Who, s05e13, The Big Bang

quotes.quote: What we call a disaster is tied up in what we find dramatic.
If you think this Universe is bad, you should see some of the others.
There's a big difference between making a simple product and making a product simple.
Anyone who says distributed systems are easy does not have sufficient experience with distributed systems.
I don't care that they stole my idea - I care that they don't have any of their own.
Two aesthetics exist: the passive aesthetic of mirrors and the active aesthetic of prisms.
Simplicity is a great virtue but it requires hard work to achieve it and education to appreciate it. And to make matters worse: complexity sells better.
If you get, give. If you learn, teach.
The art of progress is to preserve order amid change and to preserve change amid order.
The walls between art and engineering exist only in our minds.
You're only given one little spark of madness. You mustn't lose it.
People do not seem to realize that their opinion of the world is also a confession of their character.
I am not what happened to me. I am what I choose to become.
In the future, everyone will want to be anonymous for fifteen minutes.
Progress feels good. But progress feels even better when you put it to the test and learn something.
Growing old is mandatory. Growing up is optional.
There are far better things ahead than any we leave behind.
We don't need more humanities majors in tech, we need fewer sociopaths elevated to leadership.

Hard times are coming, when we�ll be wanting the voices of writers who can see alternatives to how we live now, can see through our fear-stricken society and its obsessive technologies to other ways of being, and even imagine real grounds for hope.
Leaders who don't listen will eventually be surrounded by people who have nothing to say.
Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
While 'losing control' is one of the biggest fears in management, 'having control' is one of the biggest illusions.
Each epoch dreams the one to follow.
'If it weren't for the people, the god-damn people' said Finnerty, 'always getting tangled up in the machinery. If it weren�t for them, the world would be an engineer's paradise.'
Programming is not a zero-sum game. Teaching something to a fellow programmer doesn�t take it away from you.'
Whenever you write, whatever you write, never make the mistake of assuming the audience is any less intelligent than you are.'
What one programmer can do in one month, two programmers can do in two months.
Architecture represents the significant decisions, where significance is measured by the cost of change.
Meetings are indispensable when you don't want to do anything.
I must create a system, or be enslaved by another man's.
Style is knowing who you are, what you want to say, and not giving a damn.
Style is not something applied. It is something that permeates. Is is of the nature of that in which it is found, whether the poem, the manner of a god, the bearing of a man. It is not a dress.
There's no such thing as a permanent state of turmoil. Eventually, turmoil becomes normal.
The new beautiful freaks will teach us all how to play again (and they'll suffer society's penalty).
Life's too short to play the game.  If you can't exist outside of the system, then you can't make your own choices, you can't follow your own muse.
Being well-enough known to be pirated [is] a crowning achievement.
Rembmer that people break down, too, not just machinery.
Software is done the way that the dishes are done. You can only consider it finished if you never plan on using it again.
When you invent the ship, you also invent the shipwreck. Every technology carries its own negativity, which is invented at the same time as technical progress.
I'm becoming convinced that we know far less than we think and we think much less than we know.
The premature codification of complex issues into neat and tidy solutions is a large consultancy disease and a fertile field for snake oil sales people and charlitans.
We are called to be architects of the future, not its victims.

Unrealistic beliefs on scope - often hidden and undiscussed - kill high standards. To achieve high standards yourself or as part of a team, you need to form and proactively communicate realistic beliefs about how hard something is going to be.
Merit rating rewards people that do well in the system. It does not reward attempts to improve the system.
Storing information means increasing the complexity of the mechanism.
We aren't trying to ship software as fast as possible, we are trying to add value as fast as possible.
Lord, grant me the skill to recognize and critique bad design, the humility to not criticize opinionated design that differs from my opinions, and the wisdom to know the difference.
The key to writing less code and causing less rework is to write better abstractions. Get better at identifying and avoiding repetative code.
Being a professional is the willingness to put oneself in the position of a novice, over and over, so we can continue to learn, improve, and apply.
Building the wrong thing is the biggest waste in software development.
Reliable systems don't have to be perfect - they have to have sensible tradeoffs.
Code is not self-documenting. Anyone who tells you otherwise is lying as they mint technical debt.
When on teaches, two learn.
Any sufficiently advanced incompetence is indistinguishable from malice.
Uncertainty is an uncomfortable position, but certainty is an absurd one.
Quality is doing it right when no one is watching.
When one teaches, two learn.
World War III is a guerrilla information war with no division between military and civilian participation.
I conceive that the great part of the miseries of mankind are brought upon them by false estimates they have made of the value of things.
I came to see, in my time at IBM, that culture isn't just one aspect of the game - it is the game.
If you watch trillions of things, you will often see one-in-a-million coincidences.
No system can survive that doesn't serve a useful purpose.
The person who loves their dream of community will destroy community (even if their intentions are ever so earnest), but the person who loves those around them will create community.
People with targets and jobs dependent on meeting them will probably meet the targets - even if they have to destroy the enterprise to do it.
If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
The danger of computers becoming like humans is not as great as the danger of humans becoming like computers.
There is no reason anyone would want a computer in their home.
From cells to cities, from satellites to web sites, at a certain level of abstraction every system manifests a message passing architecture.
I think our drug of choice these days is knowing who we're better than.
Imagination is the only weapon in the war against reality.
It is shameful and sad how many root causes fester while people build processes to make the symptoms tolerable.
Every manager supposes that they are doing their best. They are, and this is the problem.
Talent is insignifigant. I know a lot of talented ruins. Beyond talent lie all the usual words: discipline, love, luck, but most of all, endurance.
The question that drives evangelism for me is: are people aware? The question that drives advocacy is: are people successful?
Rarely is anyone thanked for the work they did to prevent the disaster that didn't happen.
Why would you ever spend a few minutes reading the documentation when you can spend a few hours randomly trying things?
Simple, clear purpose and principles give rise to complex and intelligent behavior. Complex rules and regulations give rise to simple and stupid behavior.
-just remember that your real job is that if you are free, you need to free somebody else. If you have some power, then your job is to empower somebody else.
When you're finished changing, you're finished.
It is not the domain experts knowledge that goes to production, it is the assumption of the developers.
There is only one corner of the universe we can be certain of improving, and that's our own selves.
Life isn't a support system for art. It's the other way around.
First let chaos reign, then reign in chaos.
The secret to building great products is not creating awesome features, it's to make your users awesome.
Before you distrub the system in any way, watch how it behaves.
Being a genius doesn't excuse being an asshole.
The code you write is future tech debt. The problem you help solve are business value.
Forcing people to have an answer to every problem they report is an obstacle that makes it harder for them to report problems.
What is the robbing of a bank compared to the founding of a bank?
'Reality' is the temporary resultant of continuous struggles between rival gangs of programmers. And every moment is a new and shocking Transvaluation of all we have ever been.
Once men turned their thinking over to machines in the hope that this would set them free. But that only permitted other men with machines to enslave them.
Nothing can be changed until it is faced.
As the births of living creatures are at first ill-shapen, so are all innovations, which are the births of time.
Beware the investment activity that produces applause. The great moves are usually greated by yawns.
Don't underestimate the compounding awesomeness of continually fixing small broken things.
When people are holding on tightly to the past, it's because there is something they value and they have no idea of what might be valuable in the future.
If a machine is expected to be infallible, it cannot also be intelligent.
Much that passes as idealism is disguised hatred or disguised love of power.
People won't self-organize around systems they don't understand. People won't make experiments if they're afraid of breaking invisible things.
Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain.
quotes.attribution: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

quotes.quote: There is nothing new under the sun, but there are new suns.
Either write things worth reading, or do things worth the writing.
Everything is narrative. The stories we tell our kids is the world those kids create.
Growth for the sake of growth is the ideology of the cancer cell.
If our 'message' is anything, it's a positive approach to life. That life is basically good. People are basically good.

The problem with being clever and original in software design is that it gets to be a habit - you start reflexively making things cute and complicated when you should be keeping them robust and simple.
[In a changing world] the ability to learn faster than competitors may be the only sustainable competitive advantage.
Don’t think about making art, just get it done. Let everyone else decide if it’s good or bad, whether they love it or hate it. While they are deciding, make even more art.
The art of programming is the art of organizing complexity; mastering multitude & avoiding its chaos as effectively as possible.
If you want to learn to do a thing both well and fast, then do it well and slow for approximately forever.
Code is for humans. If it was exclusively for computers, we’d have no need for a high-level language like Javascript or Python.
Management's job is to improve the system. Management's job is to know which systems are stable and which are not. Management's job is to look ahead. Management's job is to optimize the whole system.
Humans have better things to do than pretend to be machines.
Don't ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive and go do it. Because what the world needs is more people who have come alive.
Always implement things when you actually need them, never when you just foresee that you need them.
I define a leader as anyone who takes responsibility for finding the potential in people and processes, and who has the courage to develop that potential.
It may look like a crisis, but it's only the end of an illusion.
If you want to transform your culture, start with yourself as a leader.
Coordination and communication swamp all other costs in modern software development.
The absence of limitations is the enemy of art.
To do a dull thing with style-now that's what I call art.
Programmers have to fight against the two most destructive forces in the universe: entropy and stupidity.
It is not the domain experts knowledge that goes to production, it is the assumption of the developers.

A program is not only code written to be executed by a machine; primarily it is a letter, written in a formal language by a programmer, where he explains to another programmer which problem he had and how he solved it.
You haven't mastered a tool until you understand when it should not be used.
Rarely do we find men who willingly engage in hard, solid thinking. There is an almost universal quest for easy answers and half-baked solutions.
Collaboration without a common language is just noise before failure.
One of the biggest fallacies in tech is that you can solve culture problems by writing the perfect piece of code.
Most people want to improve, but few want to hear from an outsider - or from anyone else for that matter - that they are wrong.

There are things that can be measured. There are things that are worth measuring. But what can be measured is not always what is worth measuring; what gets measured may have no realtionship to what we really want to know.
Human intelligence is dynamic, multi sensory, complex, uncertain, and interactive. AI today is still simple, static, and disembodied.
Every line of code has an ethical dimension. Deciding to not write code for ethical reasons falls within this definition.
The myth of management is that it exists. The myth of communications is that it occurred. The myth of software is that it's ever done.
If we could fix trust, we could fix the system architecture.
The essense of systems is relationships, interfaces, form, fit and function.

We've all been raised on television to believe that one day we'd all be millionaires, and movie gods, and rock stars. But we won't. And we're slowly learning that fact. And we're very, very pissed off.
A good manager does their best to empower their people within the system. A great manager does their best to dismantle any system that takes people's power away in the first place.
Advocating for quality is like advocating for virtue, or for fairness; it's empty advocacy until we agree on what we mean.
Absorb what is useful; discard what is not; add what is uniquely your own.
Anything invented after you're thirty-five is against the natural order of things.
You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read.
If you care about productivity, you care about internal code quality. If you want to go faster tomorrow, you care about the quality of the code you wrote today.
Investments in technology are also investments in people, and these investments will make our technology process more sustainable.
The human soul doesn't want to be advised or fixed or saved. It simply wants to be witnessed - to be seen, heard, and companioned exactly as it is.
Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
Good management is more about gardening than firefighting.
One man practicing kindness in the wilderness is worth all the temples this world pulls.
Cooperation requires conflict but not coersion.
You begin saving the world by saving one man at a time; all else is grandiose romanticism or politics.
Writing is not fun, but having written is great.
You can only convince people who think they can benefit from being convinced.
Autonomy has become compulsive, we need to remember we are still tribal creatures that require tribal safety.
If we saw tomorrow's newspaper today, tomorrow would never happen.
Everything has been said before, but since nobody listens we have to keep going back and beginning all over again.
